commitResults.messageTitle: Chatbot for iP needs initial skeletal setup
commitResults.messageBody:
Duke was the default setup for CS2103T's iP project, chatbot needs to be personalised

Rename Duke.java to Locky.java and update greeting and exit messages.

Locky is short and memorable and tied to the Gen-Z phrase "lock in" making it effective for a study to-do chatbot.

All traces of "Duke" are removed from the codebase to avoid confusion

commitResults.messageTitle: The chatbot only greets the user once and then waits for input, but does not properly echo commands or exit cleanly when "bye" is typed.
commitResults.messageBody:
Without a loop that echoes the commands, the chatbot will not meet Level 1 requirements

An input loop that echoes any user command back to the console is implemented, and "bye" is added as a termination connection.

Echoing commands is the most rudimentary way to assess the chatbot's interaction with user response, and adding a termination condition ensures it does not run forever.

commitResults.messageTitle: The chatbot currently has no way to retain previous commands and list them out.
commitResults.messageBody:
The chatbot should be able to store commands in a list and return them as prompted, in order to meet Duke Level-2 requirements.

Implement an ArrayList to store user-entered text, update the loop to add non-list commands to the list, and handle list command to print all stored tasks.

ArrayList has no fixed limit on the number of items in a list, hence can expand dynamically. Additional conditional should be implemented to add list feature.

Each added task is acknowledged with a confirmation message, and tasks are displayed in a numbered format when "list" is entered.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done or undone to Locky.
commitResults.messageBody:
Mark tasks as done to meet Level-3 specs in CS2103T iP

Introduce a class Task with properties description and isDone, and use mark and unmark markers to mark a task as done.

Use a Task class to employ encapsulation to ensure code remains modular and external code does not interfere with internal.

Display tasks with internal toString() method with [X] and [] markers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for three different task types: Todo, Deadline, and Event
commitResults.messageBody:
Meet iP requirements of CS2103T Level 4.

Apply inheritance by creating 3 subclasses of superclass Task, with Deadline taking in extra parameter deadline and Event extra parameters start and end.

Add additional support for extracting deadlines through importing Java regex library.

Include input.txt and EXPECTED.txt within text-ui-test directory with runtest.sh scripts

Verify chatbot responses to common commands and reduce need for manual testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add error handling for invalid task inputs
commitResults.messageBody:
Meet CS2103T iP Level 5 requirements.

Implement the extension A-Exceptions by creating new LockyException class.
Create new function handleLine that throws LockyException for various incorrect inputs.
Update input.txt and EXPECTED.txt to handle errors.

Dedicated LockyException communicates user-specific error in Locky, not generic runtime failure.
New function handleLine allows separation of concerns by isolating a function for parsing and validation, hence easier future maintenance of code.
Ensure Locky is tested for invalid test cases.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add delete task feature to Locky.
commitResults.messageBody:
Meet Level 6 requirements in CS2103T iP Level-6.

Add switch case "delete" to handleLine, within mark and unmark case.

This keeps parser patterns consistent. Keep in "mark" "unmark" case to reduce redundancy in error handling as all features require a task number.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix inputs and expected outputs with updated test cases.
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, no error handling for new "delete" task feature.

Added test cases "delete" and "delete 2".

These test cases implement both error handling and checking whether delete removes the task from list properly.
